creator: okushnir@amaranthllc.com
text:
In vsshistory task (MSVSSHISTORY.java), execute() says:

commandLine.createArgument().setValue("-I-");  // ignore all errors

I believe this should read:

commandLine.createArgument().setValue("-I-Y");  // ignore all errors

creator: conor@apache.org
text:
According to the flags in MSVSS.java -I- is the default auto response. I have no
idea what saying yes to every response would be in the VSS history command. 

Can you or someone confirm that -I- does not work with history, and that -I-Y is
benign/appropriate.

An alternative would be to implement the setAutoresponse and getAutorepsonse
methods of all the other command (possibly moving to the base class)

The documentation for the History command for VSS states that" "-I-" = "Ignore:
Do not ask for input under any circumstances."

As for the alternative (moving to base class) I've already done this and more

http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=ant-dev&m=103129179305511&w=2

But the code never got commited :(

I'll make sure they are still in sync if someone would be willing to commit
them. I'll also try to fix the other outstanding VSS bugs after my refactorings
get in.

Jesse
creator: jesse@cryptocard.com

text:
OK, I've applied the refactoring and it seems the current -I- setting is
correct. Can you confirm that the new code (In CVS or a nightly build) works as
you expect.
creator: conor@apache.org
